channel.title: Where are my track people?
channel.description:
Well considering I've seen a ton of posts involving track, track practice, etc, I'd like to hear from everyone else who does runs track. What events do you do? What are your best times? etc. I'm more of a field person to be honest though. I'm doing 100m sprints and hurdles, but I'm trying to focus on long jump, triple jump, and pole vault this season. I can't wait until I'm good at pole vault considering its one of my favorite events so far :D
So, what are you all doing on track?

item.title: Where are my track people?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

Bump. It’s that time of the year again yaaaaay.

Who’s running track this year and what events are you doing? What times are you trying to reach?

I’m a 400 & 800 runner and I’m going for a 49 in the 400 and 2:00 in the 800. This is my Junior year

Read full topic

item.title: Where are my track people?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:120, topic:385491”]This season seems to have moved way too fast. Our 1600M relay is looking good for state competition, not sure about my 400M dash.

Currently the best (or one of the best) distance runners is averaging around 4:22-4:24 miles and about exactly double that for 2 miles. He averages around 1:06 per lap, every lap. Unfortunately he’s not on our team.[/quote]

Sounds about D1 collegiate level if he gets down to about 70 per lap if he wants to run the 5K-10K
Otherwise, he’ll need to drop to about 62.

Read full topic

I plan to try the mile competitively soon. I’m hoping to get sub 5:30 for my first official time :s And I never plan to race the 2 mile… like ever haha.

item.title: Where are my track people?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:117, topic:385491”][quote author=rip4d link=topic=481243.msg4292865#msg4292865 date=1367638553]
Bumping this thread with some updates to my season:

First of all, I’ve been practicing with the distance portion of my team, so I’ve been running quite a few 400s! Only at 1’02", but I’m happy with it. I also ran in a 4x200 relay today at the Ocean County Relays, and I ran my leg in 25 seconds, beating my previous best by a bit over two seconds, and officially being the 4th best 200 runner on my team! I’m so happy I can’t stand it
[/quote]

distance
400s

hahahahaha funny. Just for practice we had a 45 minute run today… you can’t call yourself distance until you’ve ran at least a 1600 in a race, and a true distance person has done at least one 2 mile. It’s a hell of a run.[/quote]

this, I hate the 2 mile. although the mile is one of my better distance races.

Read full topic

I got ripped off in my conference race in the 800m, ran a 1:59 in high winds. Should’ve been a 1:55.

I got put on the 4x4 A-team. Somehow I’m one of the fastest 400m runners on the team.

item.title: Where are my track people?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Track season is back and I am running well. Placed 23rd out of 95 collegiate athletes in the ACC conference (my university is in the BSC) in my 800m. Ran my official personal record (on paper) at a 1:58.06. Senior year I ran at State with a 1:58.32-4 (I can’t remember exactly). I almost beat one of my seniors (he’s a junior atm). He placed 22nd with a 1:57.92.

Also, I ran my PR (on paper) for the 5k with a 18:02 a few months ago. I can probably easily run a sub/mid-17 now.

How are you guys doing?

Read full topic

item.title: Where are my track people?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Cross country is amazing and by far my favorite sport. The distance is long enough to where you don’t have to completely destroy your body going out, however fast enough to where, if you’re good, you can be done in what seems like no time. It also attracts a weird group of people (of which I fit greatly into), which allows for fun to. The meets are MUCH better, as they’ll last 2 hours max, while your typical track meet can be anywhere from 3-9 hours, even more. The training is easier to, as you’ll find that you’re mostly doing nice, long runs (45-60 mins), as apposed to track workouts. The season is also better because, while it may start a bit hot, it will cool out by the end of the season. I mostly use track to get in shape for cross country. Also, during the day, make sure you drink a lot of water. A rule of thumb is to take your weight, divide it by two, then drink that quantity in oz.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:107, topic:385491”]Going to have to do some workouts this week or I will die in that 400. I have been eating and drinking complete crap for the past like 4 days.

I signed up for cross country this year too. Going to start training for it when State passes by. Any tips or what to expect? I’m not a great distance runner, but I’m not the worst either.[/quote]

I also signed up for the first time.

I’m just going to keep running 3 miles everyday and try to improve my time, because we only do 5ks which is roughly 3 miles.

I used to run everyday.

Now I don’t have to run to the busstop LO0L.
Anyways. I am also very interested in track, i’m just not in shape for it anymore ;-;
Good luck track ;D

item.title: Where are my track people?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:102, topic:385491”][quote author=rip4d link=topic=481243.msg4001016#msg4001016 date=1337993737]
I did decent this year. Greatly improved my pole vaulting - went from 8 feet in the beginning of the season to nearly 11 feet. My team went to state sectionals today but I haven’t heard any results yet. I’m hoping my friend breaks his pole vault record again, considering he’s already broken our school’s, which is now at 15’ 1" a few more inches and he’ll have our pole vault camp’s record for highest high school vault!
[/quote]

Very nice. Our best pole vaulter is at 13’6"" I think.

My track team is awful, so we did pretty bad. What is your 400M dash time?

I got a 54.9#(forgot the last digit.) and I’m a freshman, hoping to get into the high 40’s by Junior year. My 4x4 team is pretty bad cause like I said, my track team sucks. I’m one of the best, being only a freshman.

In the open 400M, my time is 54.07. However my split time for the 4x400 is generally around 53.2 or a bit lower. I haven’t hit 52 yet. My second race is always better. I’m a junior right now so it’s not THAT great, but the sectional champ ran a 50.7. State champion usually runs around a 48-49.[/quote]

That’s about the same for where I live. But my 2nd lap is always a lot worse…

Read full topic

you are such athletes!!! omg!!!

item.title: Where are my track people?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Regionals… the 4x800 dash.

Opening runner - 2:03. We expected a 2:08 from him. Currently holding second place
Second Leg - 2:02. Expected a 2:09 from him, we move up to first place.
Third Leg - I should’ve run this, but some shitty kid got my spot somehow. 2:13. We move to 5th.
Fourth Leg - On track for a 1:57, holding 3rd. Last 70 meters, 3rd 4th and 5th bunched up. Top 4 go to states. He’s shoved, falls, loses the place, get’s 5th, other team is not DQ’d. We do not go to states for the 4x800.

Read full topic

item.title: Where are my track people?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:99, topic:385491”]Bringing this back from the dead again. ;D

How did the season go for you guys? This year, I made it to Sectionals in the 400M Dash, and probably would have in the 200M Dash as well if my coach would have put me in it (but then again it’s probably good she didn’t, I’d be exhausted). We were regional champs in the 4x400 Relay and will also be heading over to State in a week for it after placing 4th (we missed 3rd by like half a second) at Sectionals! :)[/quote]

My track team is awful, so we did pretty bad. What is your 400M dash time?

I got a 54.9#(forgot the last digit.) and I’m a freshman, hoping to get into the high 40’s by Junior year. My 4x4 team is pretty bad cause like I said, my track team sucks. I’m one of the best, being only a freshman.

I also run the 800M, but my time could use a lot of improvement. 2:19 atm hoping to bring that to 2:10.

I’d say overall it was a good year for me, because I’m among the top of all freshman, and usually beat a lot of sophomores, but as a team, this season sucked.

Pic of me running the 800(I look like I’m running soooo slow, lmao!): http://fl.milesplit.com/photos/files/3532262#content
Found more photos but i look horribad.

Read full topic

item.description:

Bringing this back from the dead again. ;D

How did the season go for you guys? This year, I made it to Sectionals in the 400M Dash, and probably would have in the 200M Dash as well if my coach would have put me in it (but then again it’s probably good she didn’t, I’d be exhausted). We were regional champs in the 4x400 Relay and will also be heading over to State in a week for it after placing 4th (we missed 3rd by like half a second) at Sectionals!
